instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green / No Orange light - but runs from battery and reads mag safe
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

this board had minor liquid damage (PICTURE) Replaced chip and also resistor and capacitors, but still no light, original problem was no light and does not charge battery, board has already been ultrasonic, replaced <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> AND <RESISTOR>R6996</RESISTOR>,

<CHIP>U6990</CHIP>:

Pin 1 - 1.27v
Pin 2 - 3.42v
Pin 3 - 7.24v
Pin 4 - 3.43v
Pin 5 - 0v
Pin 6 - 16.15v
Pin 7 - 0v
Pin 8 - 16.5v

anyone can help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green / No Orange light - but runs from battery and reads mag safe
threads.message: Known good IO board and flat cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green / No Orange light - but runs from battery and reads mag safe
threads.message: Yes, known working IO board and flat cable,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green / No Orange light - but runs from battery and reads mag safe
threads.message: Does <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> from pin 2 make it to J4700?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Green / No Orange light - but runs from battery and reads mag safe
threads.message: Also the voltage on the middle pin of the magsafe connector with magsafe plugged in? If not 3V then 3V42 is probably not making it to the IO board due to corroded connector on the board.
